brewery.brewery_description: We brew modern and experimental small batch beer, using fresh ingredients and ideas.

beer.beer_description:
This beer uses a base of dark malt and oats to create a full-bodied, rich stout with notes of dark chocolate and malt.
We then filtered it through a blend of freshly ground coffee supplied by our friends at Hark! Coffee Roasters.
We collaborated on a custom blend of fluid bed roasted, 100% organic Ugandan and Peruvian coffee beans, which has a smooth, rounded flavour with a bold coffee punch.

user.bio: Beer is my life.
Every day is craft beer day

items.checkin_comment: I would say it’s quite smooth and little creamy not what I expected but a smooth comfy ride, you get the passion fruit and feel it’s a nice after dinner beer in summer

user.bio: Nerd and stout enjoyer

beer.beer_description:
Hey now! This oat cream is your chance to shine.
With Riwaka hops bringing tropical citrus and passionfruit, it’s smooth, creamy and bursting with flavour. So go ahead, get your game on, go for gold. 
This beer’s the way we like it, and we’ll never get bored.

Malt/Other: Pilsner, Malted Oats, Rolled Oats, Wheat, Gladiator, Lactose

Hops: Citra, Riwaka Cryo

Yeast: Ferveo English Ale II

Reshaped from: taking the backstreets

user.bio: I do not have working tastebuds ergo my ratings will be random and based on nothing. beer :y:

items.badge_description: You're getting the hang of it, but there’s much more to try. That’s over 50 unique brews!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 35 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 8!

You may not be able to see through the haze, but that juicy, hoppy goodness goes down smooth. What started as a trend is here to stay. That's 10 different beers with the style of IPA - New England / Hazy, Pale Ale - New England / Hazy, IPA - Milkshake, or Pale Ale - Milkshake. Try 5 more for Level 3!
Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 45 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 10.

Every day is craft beer day

beer.beer_description:
Four years of brewing has taught us that simplicity, precision and patience reveal the sharpest expression of hops. This West Coast IPA, built on a clean grist bill and fermented warm with lager yeast, shines with crystal clarity. Old school and new world hops deliver resin, citrus and pine in perfect balance – a beer that embodies focus.

ABV 7.8%  IBU 50

Malt: Pilsner, Carapils, Flaked Corn
Hops: Cascade, Simcoe, Citra, Southern Cross
Yeast: Lallemand Diamond

user.bio: A Bloke from the Bush.
Work less, play more, drink better beer

items.checkin_comment: Tasty coffee stout, not a bad shot. Rating 3.80.

user.bio: Love trying all the different beers, and dont mind a good scotch. Ratings are mine on style and taste for that style.

beer.beer_description:
Dark, smooth, and unapologetically bold.
This stout layers deep roasted malts with rich, freshly brewed coffee character. Crema, chocolate and roast.
Built for slow sips and late nights, it’s your new favourite excuse to stay out.

ABV: 7.2% IBU: 20

Malt/Other: Munich, Vienna, Rolled Oats, Eclipse Wheat, Light Chocolate, Roasted Barley, Coffee
Hops: CTZ
Yeast: S-04
Reshaped from: the daily grind

user.bio:
To drink is human; to drink craft beer is divine.
Lord, beer me strength.
Better to burn out then fade away…!
Work less, play more, drink better beer
Ipa, dipa, neipa, lover who is giving a lots of love to russian imperial stouts nowadays??
"Piwnyja Volaty" breweriana collectors club.
You never poopoo a beer right off; it usually takes a while before that happens - paraphrasing Homer Simpson
Beer makes everything better

beer.beer_description:
Every lesson we’ve learned about building hop layers comes together here. A stripped-back base of pure pilsner malt and a clean fermentation let Mosaic, BRU-1, Krush and Chinook run wild, while King Louie BrewGas pushes the dank factor into new territory. Fresh pine, tropical fruit and sticky resin make this pale a force of its own.
 
Malt: Pilsner, Carapils

Hops: Mosaic, BRU-1, Krush, Chinook, King Louis XIII BrewGas

Yeast: US-05

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 155 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 32! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.checkin_comment: Do love a red, and this one ecjoes as a solid one.

user.bio: Love trying all the different beers, and dont mind a good scotch. Ratings are mine on style and taste for that style.

beer.beer_description:
Citrus and pine lead the charge here, with Eclipse and Amarillo laying down layers of mandarin, grapefruit, and sticky bitterness, whilst rich malt keeps this IPA grounded. Big, bold, and echoing with flavour, this is a throwback hit with just enough of a modern twist to keep you on your toes.

Malt/Other: Pilsner, Aurora, Vienna, Redback, Shepherds Delight, Gladiator
Hops: CTZ, Eclipse, Amarillo
Yeast: US-05
Reshaped from: reverbs of pine & peel

items.badge_description: You don't always intend to go for beers with a double digit ABV, but when you do, you make it count! Cheers to you, but be careful, 10% and up can really pack a punch. That's 25 different beers with an ABV of 10% and up. Try 5 more for Level 6!

Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That’s 150 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 31!

beer.beer_description:
Hazy. Soft. Juicy!

This beer is a modern style pale ale which is low on bitterness with huge hop aromas and fruity flavours.

We added massive amounts of hops to the whirlpool, before double dry hopping at the highest addition rates we've ever done with some of our favourite hop varieties. 

Enjoy as fresh as possible!

You may not be able to see through the haze, but that juicy, hoppy goodness goes down smooth. What started as a trend is here to stay. That's 125 different beers with the style of IPA - New England / Hazy, Pale Ale - New England / Hazy, IPA - Milkshake, or Pale Ale - Milkshake. Try 5 more for Level 26!

items.badge_description: It's New Brew Thursday! Drink any beer you have never had before on three different Thursdays in a 20 day period.

beer.beer_description:
Look up at the Nordic night sky. See the Galaxy? We beered that. It’s one of the dry hops in here, plus Citra for juiciness. 

Being a seasoned brewer, you must know about kveik; how the fruity esters are perfect for a hazy IPA. 

We beered that bit, too.

It was a bright, clear sky in tropical California. When suddenly, it turns a resinous gold hue. You know what that means… Pineapple! Grapefruit! Peach!

The fruit starts raining down on you, but at least it’s just a light shower. Uh oh, not the melon. Not the melon!

Why aren't we talking about this, people?
The medium gold hue of honeybees + sunflowers = the golden ratio. Tasting sweet citrus, orange and pine - wait - pinecones! Another golden ratio. Light, dry body + the balanced bitterness of a throwback IPA? Golden ratio! Find it in your hand right now. Wake up!

Party people! Soft mouthfeel is in the house.

Turn up those flavourful tunes and get this party rocking. We’ve got pine-lime crushing it on the beats, ripe peach on the BBQ, a novelty shirt on your back, and good times on the hazy pale horizon. 

Drink the vibes.

Hazy. Soft. Juicy!

This beer is a modern style pale ale which is low on bitterness with huge hop aromas and fruity flavours.

We added massive amounts of hops to the whirlpool, before double dry hopping at the highest addition rates we've ever done with some of our favourite hop varieties. 

Enjoy as fresh as possible!

This DDH Hazy IPA is pale straw in colour, with an inviting aroma of freshly cut tropical fruit.You’ll find bold, lingering flavours from the Mosaic up front, finishing with a massive punch of mango and citrus from El Dorado and Azacca.The yeast profile has expressions of overripe stonefruit and a hint of vanilla.A lush, velvety mouthfeel paired with a light body rounds it all out and makes this beer endlessly drinkable.

Certified crusher.

7.3% ABV  18 IBU  8 EBC  7.5g/L DH

Malt: Pale Ale, Malted Oats, Wheat Malt, Golden Naked Oats

Hops: Mosaic Incognito™, El Dorado, Azacca

Yeast: LalBrew Verdant IPA

Dry hopped the second before packaging, it’s alive! 

A mashup of crisp pilsner and New Zealand hops, it’s bursting with fresh hoppy flavour. Now look around at the flowers and citrus trees planted in the malty soil, with fluffy clouds overhead.

We beered a whole new world.

West Coast IPA’s are back, and we’re here for it!

Somehow Someway is a classic old-school West Coast IPA.
We didn’t hold back - with massive additions of Simcoe, Amarillo and Chinook hops.

Notes of pine, resin and dank mix with fresh citrus and converge into a crisp, snappy mouthfeel.
It finishes with a lingering and satisfying bitterness which results in an IPA that, we think, really hits the spot.

7.0% ABV  70 IBU  19 EBC

Malt: Maris Otter, Caramunich, Carapils
Hops: Warrior, Simcoe, Amarillo, Chinook
Yeast: BRY-97

Cheat Code uses an exciting new strain of yeast that both sours and ferments the beer all in one vessel. It seems too easy compared to traditional methods, almost like a modern brewer’s cheat code.

This juicy, hazy IPA is also loaded with a blend of Citra, Vic Secret and Strata hops for a whirlwind of flavour.

Expect tart red apple and berry notes with a fresh tropical aroma and a smooth, balanced mouthfeel for great drinkability.

ABV: 7.0% IBU: 23
EBC: 9 DH: 7.5g/L

Malt: Golden Promise, Malted Oats, Wheat, Rolled Oats
Hops: Citra Incognito™, Vic Secret, Strata
Yeast: Philly Sour
Other: Lactose

We humbly present our first oat cream IPA, heavily hopped with Citra and a hop we are legally not allowed to name…

What we can tell you, is this beer has lashings of delicious tropical fruit flavours, including peach, pineapple and passionfruit with next to no bitterness.

This fluffy oat cream IPA is also loaded with malted and rolled oats, wheat and lactose, for a silky smooth pillowy mouthfeel.

Zeitgeist, the spirit of the time - an ode to the hazy beers that we love.

Upon pouring this beer you’ll be met with a fruitbowl of flavours including orange, peach and pineapple. Hints of tropical coconut and vanilla waft across the glass.

Heavily doubly dry hopped with BRU-1 and Idaho 7 LUPOMAX with a smooth, lush body and a hint of sweetness from the lactose, this DDH oat cream IPA is perfectly balanced and endlessly drinkable.

Just what you need if you’re frying on the bench slide in the park across the street.

7.5% ABV • 10 IBU • 10 EBC

Malt: Golden Promise, Malted Oats, Wheat, Rolled Oats
Hops: Citra Incognito, BRU-1, Idaho 7 LUPOMAX
Yeast: LalBrew Verdant IPA
Other: Lactose

Your move.

Opening with the roasty chocolate malts, huh? That endgame will be refreshing.

Alternating squares of light chocolate and eclipse wheat adorn the beautiful mahogany dark lager chessboard, topped with off-white pieces.

It’s a brilliant defence for the winter months.

You must be a master.

The hearsay is true.

Explanation? Biotransformation.
Dry hopped every single day of active fermentation and saturated with extraordinary flavour.

That’s our theory - but we all know conspiracies are dumb.

We continue our exploration into Norwegian kveik yeast with the Voss strain by Sigmund Gjernes.
This kveik ferments at 39C, blasting through the process in double time, adding fruity notes of orange and citrus.

This American style pale ale has heavy whirlpool hop additions of Ekuanot, and is dry hopped with Simcoe and Mosaic cryo.

This combo brings waves of punchy citrus, juicy pineapple and fresh berries.

Patience is key here.

This imperial stout was aged for many months in carefully selected American oak ex-red wine barrels, which previously held the exceptional ‘Fortis’ single malt whisky from Starward distillery.

Roasty chocolate overtones meld into a symphony of sweet vanilla, oak and rich coffee with a warming finish.

11.5% ABV • 90 IBU • 101 EBC

Malt: American Ale, Light Chocolate, Black, Extra Special, Caramunich III, Rolled Oats
Hops: Warrior, Mt Hood
Yeast: US-05
Other: Starward Single Malt Whisky Barrels

We turned a place into a beer. We tinned Findon. Why?

Adelaide’s West gave us a home, and we wanted to cheers to that. 

We beered the bittersweet moment into a bit of bite and a sweet malt body. Taste our pride of place in the noble hop characteristics. Aw.

This beer uses a base of dark malt and oats to create a full-bodied, rich stout with notes of dark chocolate and malt.
We then filtered it through a blend of freshly ground coffee supplied by our friends at Hark! Coffee Roasters.
We collaborated on a custom blend of fluid bed roasted, 100% organic Ugandan and Peruvian coffee beans, which has a smooth, rounded flavour with a bold coffee punch.

One of our favourite modern styles of beer returns - the next Level Up from our last oat cream IPA!

Using a new commercially available Australian hop called Eclipse® (formerly HPA-016), this oat cream IPA is full of sweet mandarin and citrus flavours, with faint notes of pine.

Fluffy and juicy, this beer is also loaded with malted and rolled oats, wheat and lactose, for a silky smooth pillowy mouthfeel.

This ever so decadent dessert stout will evoke the experience of eating freshly dipped chocolate strawberries.

Brewed with a rich chocolate and crystal malt base, it is full bodied with a balanced and slightly sweet finish. After primary ferment we added hundreds of kilos of real strawberry fruit purée.

The result is dark chocolate stout flavours up front, with sweet, juicy berry flavours to finish.

A beer as dark as a moonless night! 

Our Irish stout is swirling with roasted coffee and chocolate notes that'll make your taste buds sing. A pale cream head and satisfyingly dry finish makes each sip a journey to the heart of the Irish spirit.

Sláinte!

Porters were originally brewed back in the 18th century. We’ve always been big fans of this darker, malt forward style. 

This beer has dominant notes of malt and grain, sweet smooth chocolate and caramel, with a light coffee roast finish.  

With no additives, essences, lactose or vanilla - this is a straight up, no nonsense Porter ready for your enjoyment.  

5.6% ABV, 32 IBU, 75 EBC

Malt: Ale, Brown, Munich, Light Chocolate, Light Crystal, Flaked Oats, Gladiator
Hops: East Kent Goldings, Styrian Goldings
Yeast: S-04

Brewed for our friends at Bodriggy Brewing for their Lunaverse festival, this is an easy drinking red ale which has been double dry hopped with some of our faves.

The combination of Gladfield malts create the perfect red hue, and then you're hit by the hop trio of Strata, Amarillo and El Dorado.

You'll find notes of punchy pine, ripe citrus and light passionfruit.

Malt: Ale, Aurora, Vienna, Redback, Shepherds Delight

Hops: Strata, Amarillo, El Dorado

Yeast: US-05

Citra. Citra. Citra. Boom. Done.
We didn't overthink this one, and you shouldn't either. Just Citra, three ways. Juicy citrus, soft haze, and a refreshing pop to clear your mental tabs.
Like a deep breath in beer form.

Malt: Pilsner, Rolled Oats, Malted Oats, Wheat
Hops: Citra, Citra, Citra
Yeast: Ferveo English Ale II
Reshaped from: Citra thrice, no overthinking

We continue our exploration into Norwegian kveik yeast with the Voss strain by Sigmund Gjernes.
This kveik ferments at 39C, blasting through the process in double time, adding fruity notes of orange and citrus.

This American style pale ale has heavy whirlpool hop additions of Ekuanot, and is dry hopped with Simcoe and Mosaic cryo.

This combo brings waves of punchy citrus, juicy pineapple and fresh berries.

Malt: American Ale, Munich, Medium Crystal

Hops: Ekuanot Incognito™, Mosaic Cryo, Simcoe

Yeast: Voss Kveik
